item.title: Deedee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Jess Walter
item.description: "If a police officer arrests a mime, does he need to tell him he has the right to remain silent." -- Jess Walter

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Life seems but a quick succession of busy nothings." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "As a general rule,'he had once said, 'people ask for advice only in order not to follow it; or, if they do follow it, in order to have someone to blame for giving it.' (Athos)" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "A house divided against itself cannot stand." I believe this government cannot endure, permanently half slave and half free. I do not expect the Union to be dissolved — I do not expect the house to fall — but I do expect it will cease to be divided. It will become all one thing or all the other." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Monty Python
item.description: "You see, I don't belive that libraries should be drab places where people sit in silence, that has been the main reason for our policy of employing wild animals as librarians." -- Monty Python

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Robert Harris
item.description: "Cicero smiled at us. 'The art of life is to deal with problems as they arise, rather than destory one's spirit by worrying about them too far in advance. Especially tonight." -- Robert Harris

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Ransom Riggs
item.description: "I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was." -- Ransom Riggs

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "What can be asserted without evidence can also be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Brian Aldiss
item.description: "When childhood dies, its corpses are called adults." -- Brian Aldiss

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "I like libraries. It makes me feel comfortable and secure to have walls of words, beautiful and wise, all around me. I always feel better when I can see that there is something to hold back the shadows." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The Jabalites .... They worship no god; and if we in goodness of heart do send a missionary to show them the way of life, they listen with respect to all he hath to say, and then they eat him. This doth tend to hinder the spread of light." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Deedee add a quote by William Shakespeare
Deedee add a quote by Steven Moffat
item.description:
"Demons run when a good man goes to war Night will fall and drown the sun When a good man goes to war
Friendship dies and true love lies Night will fall and the dark will rise When a good man goes to war
Demons run, but count the cost The battle's won, but the child is lost" -- Steven Moffat

item.title: Deedee add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "When the sun has set, no candle can replace it." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Joe
item.description:
" A day without the sun is like you know, night
" -- Joe

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "To argue with a man who has renounced the use and authority of reason, and whose philosophy consists in holding humanity in contempt, is like administering medicine to the dead, or endeavoring to convert an atheist by scripture." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Lewis Black
item.description: "Who knew that the devil had a factory where he made millions of fossils, which his minions distributed throughout the earth, in order to confuse my tiny brain?" -- Lewis Black

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Deep in the rain forest it was doing what it usually does in rain forests, which was raining: hence the name." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Henning Mankell
Deedee add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "It's like learning to ride a unicorn. You never forget." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Deedee add a quote by Raymond Radiguet
item.description: "Originality consists in trying to be like everybody else - and failing." -- Raymond Radiguet
